DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate impact quality life patient undergoing Whipple procedure ( pancreaticoduodenectomy , PD ) pancreatic cancer . The Whipple procedure do laparoscopic ( small incision ) open procedure ( large incision ) treat patient cancer . The goal study see difference quality life patient undergo laparoscopic open Whipple procedure . Surgical technique ( minimally invasive versus open ) discretion operate surgeon . Patients randomize treatment arm . A subset patient also ask take part pre- postoperative in-depth interview explore live experience patient resectable pancreatic cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Outcomes Minimally Invasive Versus Open Pancreaticoduodenectomy
DOC.criteria: All patient schedule pancreaticoduodenectomy eligible study . Subject must least 18 year age least minimum Age Majority accord applicable State Country Law . Subject suitable surgical candidate , i.e . able undergo general anesthesia PD diagnosis cancer Subject willing able cooperate survey participation .
